author: cnbc.com
title: Haug Partners LLP Introduces New Chief Administrative Officer Rose Sturtevant
text:
Former Chief of Office Administration Will Join the Firm in New York City
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Haug Partners LLP announced that Rosemarie Sturtevant has joined the firm as Chief Administrative Officer in their New York, Boston, and Washington D.C. offices. Sturtevant was formerly Chief of Office Administration at Holland & Knight LLP.
Sturtevant has spent more than 25 years in law firm administration, and will use her background in Human Resource Management, along with her strong leadership and communication skills at the Haug Partners LLP team. With her in-depth background at handling business affairs, Sturtevant has assembled and managed infrastructures that have added an ambitious edge to her employers. Regulating costs without affecting efficiency, and discovering and removing any interferences to peak productivity and performance are among the top strengths of Sturtevant.
Managing Partner Ed Haug commented, “We are thrilled to welcome Rose back to the firm as our first Chief Administrative Officer. Rose was a great asset to the firm when she left 10 years ago. Now after gaining additional experience and success as the chief admin at Holland & Knight and elsewhere— Rose brings that insight and experience to Haug Partners. Rose will be instrumental in helping our firm achieve its business vision of expansion practice areas and geographic growth.”
About Haug Partners LLP
Haug Partners LLP is a national law firm that provides integrated multidisciplinary legal services for life science and technology companies. With offices in New York, Washington, D.C., and Boston, and through working partnerships with firms in Germany, China, and Japan, Haug Partners has the resources, technical expertise, legal acumen, and business judgment to consistently deliver optimal outcomes for clients.
